item.title: Jason add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "There is no greater agony than bearing an untold story inside you." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Jason add a quote by Muhammad Ali
item.description: "Others may know pleasure, but pleasure is not happiness. It has no more importance than a shadow following a man." -- Muhammad Ali

item.title: Jason add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "When I despair, I remember that all through history the way of truth and love have always won. There have been tyrants and murderers, and for a time, they can seem invincible, but in the end, they always fall. Think of it--always." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Jason add a quote by Walter Mosley
item.description: "The job of the writer is to take a close and uncomfortable look at the world they inhabit, the world we all inhabit, and the job of the novel is to make the corpse stink." -- Walter Mosley

item.title: Jason add a quote by Emmet Fox
item.description: "If you could only love enough, you could be the most powerful person in the world." -- Emmet Fox

item.title: Jason add a quote by CHOGYAM TRUNGPA
item.description: "The ideal of warriorship is that the warrior should be sad and tender, and because of that, the warrior can be very brave as well." -- CHOGYAM TRUNGPA

item.title: Jason add a quote by Miguel Pinero
item.description: "when you're cool for twenty, you get paid for twenty-one." -- Miguel Pinero

item.title: Jason add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "Perhaps all the dragons in our lives are princesses who are only waiting to see us act, just once, with beauty and courage. Perhaps everything that frightens us is, in its deepest essence, something helpless that wants our love." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Jason add a quote by Wendell Berry
item.description: "Let us have the candor to acknowledge that what we call "the economy" or "the free market" is less and less distinguishable from warfare." -- Wendell Berry

item.title: Jason add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "Make it a rule never to give a child a book you would not read yourself." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Jason add a quote by Zora Neale Hurston
item.description: "There are years that ask questions and years that answer." -- Zora Neale Hurston

item.title: Jason add a quote by Marcel Proust
item.description: "It comes so soon, the moment when there is nothing left to wait for." -- Marcel Proust

item.title: Jason add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "Be patient toward all that is unsolved in your heart and try to love the questions themselves, like locked rooms and like books that are now written in a very foreign tongue. Do not now seek the answers, which cannot be given you because you would not be able to live them. And the point is, to live everything. Live the questions now. Perhaps you will then gradually, without noticing it, live along some distant day into the answer." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Jason add a quote by William Gibson
item.description: "The street finds its own uses for things." -- William Gibson

item.title: Jason add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "The first time I managed to pick up a basketball I knew I was destined to lead the UK to another National championship. ... Even now, so many years later, I still believe Kentucky will go undefeated in March & win everything." -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Jason add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "Everywhere I go I'm asked if I think the university stifles writers. My opinion is that they don't stifle enough of them. There's many a best-seller that could have been prevented by a good teacher." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Jason add a quote by Zelda Fitzgerald
item.description: "Nobody has ever measured, not even poets, how much the heart can hold." -- Zelda Fitzgerald

item.title: Jason add a quote by George Eliot
item.description: "I like not only to be loved, but also to be told that I am loved. I am not sure that you are of the same mind. But the realm of silence is large enough beyond the grave. This is the world of light and speech, and I shall take leave to tell you that you are very dear." -- George Eliot

item.title: Jason add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "My goal in life is to unite my avocation with my vocation, As my two eyes make one in sight." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Jason add a quote by Walt Whitman
item.description: "This is what you shall do; Love the earth and sun and the animals, despise riches, give alms to every one that asks, stand up for the stupid and crazy, devote your income and labor to others, hate tyrants, argue not concerning God, have patience and indulgence toward the people, take off your hat to nothing known or unknown or to any man or number of men, go freely with powerful uneducated persons and with the young and with the mothers of families, read these leaves in the open air every season of every year of your life, re-examine all you have been told at school or church or in any book, dismiss whatever insults your own soul, and your very flesh shall be a great poem and have the richest fluency not only in its words but in the silent lines of its lips and face and between the lashes of your eyes and in every motion and joint of your body." -- Walt Whitman

item.title: Jason add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Everybody can be great...because anybody can serve. You don't have to have a college degree to serve. You don't have to make your subject and verb agree to serve. You only need a heart full of grace. A soul generated by love." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Jason add a quote by Wendell Berry
item.description: "Whether we and our politicians know it or not, Nature is party to all our deals and decisions, and she has more votes, a longer memory, and a sterner sense of justice than we do." -- Wendell Berry

item.title: Jason add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "At the end of life we will not be judged by how many diplomas we have received, how much money we have made, how many great things we have done. We will be judged by "I was hungry, and you gave me something to eat, I was naked and you clothed me. I was homeless, and you took me in." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Jason add a quote by David Byrne
item.description: "Sometimes it's a form of love just to talk to somebody that you have nothing in common with and still be fascinated by their presence." -- David Byrne

item.title: Jason add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "I am more than just a Serious basketball fan. I am a life-long Addict. I was addicted from birth, in fact, because I was born in Kentucky." -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Jason add a quote by Malcolm X
item.description: "We declare our right on this earth...to be a human being, to be respected as a human being, to be given the rights of a human being in this society, on this earth, in this day, which we intend to bring into existence by any means necessary." -- Malcolm X

item.title: Jason add a quote by Malcolm X
item.description: "Education is our passport to the future, for tomorrow belongs to the people who prepare for it today." -- Malcolm X

item.title: Jason add a quote by Malcolm X
item.description: "How can you thank a man for giving you what's already yours? How then can you thank him for giving you only part of what is yours?" -- Malcolm X

item.title: Jason add a quote by Malcolm X
item.description: "Truth is on the side of the oppressed." -- Malcolm X

item.title: Jason add a quote by Malcolm X
item.description: "I for one believe that if you give people a thorough understanding of what confronts them and the basic causes that produce it, they'll create their own program, and when the people create a program, you get action." -- Malcolm X
